summary: This is a court order from the Southern District of New York regarding the case USA v. Maxwell. It grants Ghislaine Maxwell's request to adjourn her arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment and reschedules it for April 23, 2021. The document also contains a list of attorneys and legal staff who were electronically notified of the order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

events.title: Court Order Issued Rescheduling Arraignment
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan signed an order granting Ghislaine Maxwell's request to adjourn her arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment and rescheduled it for April 23, 2021.

events.title: Rescheduled Arraignment
events.description: The arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell on the S2 Superseding Indictment is scheduled to occur at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse in New York.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, Courtroom 24B, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on a superseding indictment (S2) was adjourned and rescheduled from an unspecified earlier date to April 23, 2021.
The order was issued by U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan on April 8, 2021.
The document reveals a substantial legal team representing Ghislaine Maxwell, including attorneys from multiple law firms (BSF, HMF, Cohen Gresser, and Sternheim Law).
The arraignment was to be conducted with COVID-19 protocols in place at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse in New York.
The case number is 1:20-cr-00330-AJN, indicating it is a criminal case filed in 2020.
